data.title: Famous Birthdays on May 31
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 31st of May. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on May 31.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 258

Margaret Beaufort, mother of Henry VII and paternal grandmother of King Henry VIII of England, born in Bletsoe Castle, Bedfordshire, England (d. 1509)

Manuel I, King of Portugal (1495-1521) during era of exploration known as "Manuel The Fortunate", born in Alcochete, Portugal (d. 1521)

Érard van der Mark, prince-bishop of Luik and cardinal, born in Sedan, Ardennes (d. 1538)

Alessandro Allori, Italian painter and carpet designer, born in Florence (d. 1607)

Feodor I (Fyodor/Theodore Ivanovich), Tsar of Russia (1584-98), born in Moscow, Russia (d. 1598)

Michał Wiśniowiecki, King of Poland (1669-73), born in Biały Kamień, Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth (d. 1673)

Marin Marais, French composer, born in Paris, France (d. 1728)

Friedrich Erhard Niedt, German composer, born in Jena, Duchy of Saxe-Jena (d. 1708)

Alexander Cruden "Alexander the Corrector", Scottish biblical scholar and eccentric, compiler of a concordance to King James Bible, born in Aberdeen, Scotland (d. 1770)

Richard Edgeworth, Anglo-Irish inventor and educationalist, born in Bath, Somerset (d. 1817)

Pierre-Victurnien Vergniaud, French politician and police leader, born in Limoges, France (d. 1793)

Ludwig Tieck, German writer, born in Berlin (d. 1853)

Johann Georg Baiter, Swiss philologist, born in Zürich, Switzerland (d. 1877)

Cesare Pugni, Italian composer, born in Genoa, Ligurian Republic (d. 1870)

Louise Farrenc (née Dumont), French pianist, composer and only female professor at the Paris Conservatory during the 19th century, born in Paris, France (d. 1875)

Horatio Seymour, American politician (18th Governor of New York), born in Onondaga, New York (d. 1886)

Édouard Deldevez, French violinist and composer, born in Paris, France (d. 1897)

1817 Georg Herwegh, German poet, born in Stuttgart, Kingdom of Württemberg (d. 1875)

John Albion Andrew, American politician (25th Governor of Massachusetts), born in Windham, Massachusetts (d. 1867)

Walt Whitman

American poet (Leaves of Grass) and volunteer nurse during the Civil War, born in West Hills, New York

Hijikata Toshizō, Japanese military leader, born in Hino, Tokyo, Japan (d. 1869)

Ernest Daudet, French journalist and writer (White Terror), born in Nîmes, France (d. 1921)

1837 Stephen Dodson Ramseur, American general and the youngest West Pointer to be Major General, born in Lincolnton, North Carolina (d. 1864)

1837 William Henry Fitzhugh Lee, American Major General (Confederate Army), born in Arlington House, Virginia (d. 1891)

Henry Sidgwick, English philosopher (Wife at University), born in Skipton, Yorkshire, England (d. 1900)

Francisco Moreno, Argentine explorer (Patagonia), and museum founder (he La Plata Museum of Natural History), born in Buenos Aires, Argentina (d. 1919)

1852 Julius Richard Petri, German microbiologist generally credited with inventing the device known as the Petri dish, born in Barmen, Kingdom of Prussia (now part of Wuppertal, Germany) (d. 1921)

Pius XI

Italian 259th Pope (1922-39), born in Desio, Lombardy-Venetia, Austrian Empire

Walter Sickert, Danish-English painter (The Miner), born in Munich (d. 1942)

Emily Bissell, American welfare worker and founder of Christmas Seals, born in Wilmington, Delaware (d. 1948)

Francis Younghusband, British journalist and explorer (1904 British expedition to Tibet), born in Murree, British India (d. 1942)

Vladimir Rebikov, Russian pianist and composer, born in Krasnoyarsk, Siberia, Russia (d. 1920)

Charles Greeley Abbot, American astronomer (Solar Constant), born in Wilton, New Hampshire (d. 1973)

1872 W. Heath Robinson, English illustrator and cartoonist (Don Quixote), born in Islington, England (d. 1944)

Italo Montemezzi, Italian composer (L'amore dei tre re), born in Vigasio, Italy (d. 1952)

Mark Hambourg, Russian-British composer, born in Boguchar, Russia (d. 1960)

Sándor Graf Festetics, Hungarian nobleman and politician (Minister of War, 1918-19), born in Dég, Fejér county, Hungary (d. 1956)

Lauri Kristian Relander, 2nd President of Finland (1925-31), born in Kurkijoki, Finland (d. 1942)

Alois Hudal, Austrian bishop who helped Nazi war criminals escape trial, born in Graz, Austria-Hungary (d. 1963)

Saint-John Perse [Alexis Leger], French diplomat and poet (Nobel Prize for Literature 1960), born in Pointe-à-Pitre, Guadeloupe (d. 1975)

Athene Seyler, British actress (Make Mine Mink), born in London, England (d. 1990)

Alida Valli [Baroness Alida von Marckenstein-Frauenberg], Italian actress (The Paradine Case, The Third Man), born in Rome, Italy (d. 2006)

Prince of Monaco (1949-2005), born in Monaco
